io.netty.channel

Interface ChannelOutboundByteHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractTrafficShapingHandler, ByteLoggingHandler, ByteToByteCodec, ByteToByteEncoder, ChannelOutboundByteHandlerAdapter, ChannelTrafficShapingHandler, GlobalTrafficShapingHandler, JdkZlibEncoder, JZlibEncoder, SctpOutboundByteStreamHandler, SnappyFramedEncoder, SslHandler, ZlibEncoder

    public interface ChannelOutboundByteHandler
    ChannelOutboundHandler which operates on bytes which are hold in a ByteBuf.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface io.netty.channel.ChannelHandler

        ChannelHandler.Sharable

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void discardOutboundReadBytes(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
      Discards the read bytes of the outbound buffer and optionally trims its unused portion to reduce memory consumption.
      void freeOutboundBuffer(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
      Invoked when this handler is not allowed to send any outbound message anymore and thus it's safe to deallocate its outbound buffer.
      ByteBuf newOutboundBuffer(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
      Return the ByteBuf which will be used for outbound data for the given ChannelHandlerContext.

      • Methods inherited from interface io.netty.channel.ChannelOperationHandler

        bind, close, connect, deregister, disconnect, flush, read, sendFile

      • Methods inherited from interface io.netty.channel.ChannelHandler

        afterAdd, afterRemove, beforeAdd, beforeRemove, exceptionCaught

    • Method Detail

      • newOutboundBuffer

        ByteBuf newOutboundBuffer(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
                          throws Exception
        Return the ByteBuf which will be used for outbound data for the given ChannelHandlerContext. Implementations should take ChannelConfig.getDefaultHandlerByteBufType() into account.

        Use of ChannelHandlerUtil.allocate(ChannelHandlerContext) is adviced.

        Throws:
        Exception

      • discardOutboundReadBytes

        void discardOutboundReadBytes(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
                              throws Exception
        Discards the read bytes of the outbound buffer and optionally trims its unused portion to reduce memory consumption. The most common implementation of this method will look like the following: 
             ctx.outboundByteBuffer().discardSomeReadBytes();
        Throws:
        Exception

      • freeOutboundBuffer

        void freeOutboundBuffer(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
                        throws Exception
        Invoked when this handler is not allowed to send any outbound message anymore and thus it's safe to deallocate its outbound buffer.
        Throws:
        Exception
